Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan
is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must
include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager, Shay Mavis, at 269-243-2725.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and
Description elimination.
(11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth reported that she was locked in her room for about 30
minutes a few months ago for experiencing a conflict with another
1

youth. Youth being locked in their rooms previously occurred at
this facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 05/14/2025.
Complainant stated Youth A reported being locked in her bedroom
at Vista Maria - Rose Hall.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/15/2025 at Vista Maria – Myriam
Hall where she currently resides. Youth A stated things are going
well for her at Myriam Hall, and she did not have concerns. Youth
A was asked to explain the locking of her bedroom door. Youth A
stated she is never locked in her bedroom at Myriam Hall. Youth A
stated Myriam Hall bedroom doors can be locked from the outside
but are never locked from the inside. Youth A stated when she
resided at Vista Maria – Rose Hall she was locked in her bedroom
during sleeping hours and one time she waited for maybe 30
minutes until a male staff (did not recall) let her out of the bedroom
to use the bathroom. Youth A stated she did not recall the month
this occurred, but it happened a long time ago.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/15/2025 at Vista Maria – Myriam
Hall. Staff 1 stated youth are not locked in their bedrooms during
sleeping hours.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/15/2025 at Vista Maria – Rose Hall.
Staff 2 stated youth bedroom doors used to be locked at bedtime
and opened in the morning, but youth are no longer locked in their
bedrooms during sleeping hours per administration directive.
Documentation
The following is from investigation 2025SIC0000172,
2025SIC0000212 and 2025SIC0000213 written by Division of
Child Welfare Licensing (DCWL) Consultant 2. It states Vista
Maria administration confirmed on 12/12/2024 that youth were
secluded in their bedrooms during sleeping hours. Vista Maria
administration provided an email authored by Former DCWL
Consultant that stated the agency could continue to lock youth in
their bedrooms during sleeping hours for the purpose of safety.
Vista Maria was found in compliance based on the incorrect
information provided by the Former DCWL Consultant. Vista Maria
administration agreed to develop a plan for youth to sleep in
unlocked rooms by 01/31/2025.
Tour Observation
Staff 1 permitted this Consultant to test the bedroom doors at
Vista Maria - Myriam Hall, which is a secure facility. The bedroom
2

doors are locked from the outside, but the bedroom doors open in
one egress motion from the inside. Myriam Hall’s main entrance
door opens freely when entering and exiting. A second door from
the foyer to the living area is secured.
Staff 2 permitted this consultant to test the bedroom doors at Vista
Maria - Rose Hall, which is a secure facility. The bedroom doors
are locked from the outside, but the bedroom doors open in one
egress motion from the inside. Rose Hall’s main entrance door
opens freely when entering and exiting. A second door from the
foyer to the living area is secured.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because 1) Youth A stated she
was locked in her bedroom a long time ago and youth were locked
in their bedrooms during sleeping hours prior to 12/24/2024, and
2) Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported youth do not currently sleep in
secured rooms.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety and
supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Failure to update Sleeping Room Hours policy and procedure.
Investigation Documentation
Vista Maria’s Sleeping Room Hours policy and procedure POL-
006-038 states “1. Residents are to observe sleeping hours
between the following hours of 11pm-7am. During which time the
bedroom doors are to be secured”. It further states “3. Residents
may be in sleeping rooms that are locked based on security and
the precautions for the program the residents reside in. In such
situations the room must be unsecured at the end of the
designated sleeping hours”. It also states “4. Building requiring
secured rooms, will require all residents to have justification for
night security precautions documented in their initial treatment
plan”.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance because their Sleeping
Room Hours policy and procedure POL-006-038 is not updated to
reflect CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
3

(11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022,
and the agency’s current practice of not securing youth in their
bedrooms during sleeping hours.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and an acceptable corrective action plan is required.
